channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Commandos in Army Standby Force take precautions to stay operationally ready
item.description:
May 07, 2020 2:00 PM

SINGAPORE - He turned operational and received the feted red beret just three weeks ago.

item.title: NEA launches new $1.76 million fund to help organisations treat and recycle food waste
item.description:
May 07, 2020 1:01 PM

SINGAPORE - The National Environment Agency (NEA) has committed $1.76 million for a new fund that will help alleviate the problem of food wastage here.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 7
item.description:
May 07, 2020 8:10 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Thursday, May 7.

item.title: Two die of Covid-19 complications; 788 new cases here
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Two more people have died of complications due to Covid-19, bringing the total number of deaths here to 20.

item.title: Buddhists turn to internet for e-Vesak Day during Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Traditionally, Buddhists visit temples on Vesak Day for rituals like chanting, three-step-one-bow and bathing of the Buddha statue, or take part in retreats.

item.title: MTI clarifies process for reopening of businesses
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

All businesses in approved categories - like cake shops and hair salons - will be granted class exemptions to reopen next week, and will not need to apply individually to the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI).

item.title: Businesses given nod to reopen need not seek MTI approval
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

All businesses in categories given the green light to resume operations on Tuesday can do so without needing to seek approval, the Ministry of Trade and Industry (MTI) said yesterday.

item.title: More trash in past month, but fewer waste collectors amid Covid-19 circuit breaker
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Domestic and trade premises generated about 73,000 tonnes of waste last month, 11 per cent more than the 66,000 tonnes in March.

item.title: Coronavirus: Expect a new normal even if current circuit breaker measures are eased
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Should Singapore wait for a perfect scenario of no new cases for a fortnight before it relaxes the circuit breaker measures? Probably not, because even this scenario would not guarantee that we are truly free of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Task force focusing on systemic shifts arising from crisis
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A task force set up to help the country deal with the longer-term impact of the coronavirus pandemic said it will focus on identifying the systemic shifts that will arise from the crisis.

item.title: Concerns of infestation as some eateries stop pest control services
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Some eateries have stopped using pest control services during the circuit breaker period, raising the spectre of another outbreak even as Singapore battles the coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Total cases in Singapore could hit 40,000 this month, say experts
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

But containment measures will help to keep the situation from spiralling out of control, experts said.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore boosting production of masks since February
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has been ramping up its domestic production of surgical masks since mid-February to meet the needs of healthcare workers.

item.title: Robinsons to shutter Jem outlet in August
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Department store chain Robinsons will soon be closing its outlet at Jem shopping mall.

item.title: Coronavirus: Man hurled vulgarities at cop, threatened public servants
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A recalcitrant offender, who hurled vulgarities at a police officer and verbally abused two public servants enforcing safe distancing measures in separate incidents amid the coronavirus outbreak, was sentenced to seven months' jail yesterday.

item.title: 16-year servicing contract a boost for Circle Line
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A new servicing contract struck between train operator SMRT and French rail multinational firm Alstom could deliver more reliable journeys on the Circle Line.

item.title: Coronavirus: Two firms fined for breaching safe distancing measures
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Two companies have been fined for breaching safe distancing measures at the workplace, as the Government steps up checks in preparation for the gradual resumption of economic activity.

item.title: HSA removes 1,700 listings making false Covid-19 claims
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

From cheap $10 illegally sold "rapid" test kits, to sanitiser that the seller claims is "guaranteed" to kill 99.9 per cent of bacteria, more than 1,700 listings of products making false Covid-19-related claims have been removed from local websites by the Health Sciences Authority (HSA) since February.

item.title: Coronavirus: Jail for man who breached stay-home notice twice
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A store packer who breached his stay-home notice (SHN) twice became the second person to receive a jail sentence over such an offence yesterday.

item.title: About 3,000 virus patients recovering at SAF camps
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

In just two weeks, six military camps were converted into Covid-19 community recovery facilities (CRFs) that now house about 3,000 foreign workers.

item.title: Man charged with attempted murder of safe distancing officer
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A 61-year-old man accused of attacking a safe distancing enforcement officer with a sharp instrument has been charged with attempted murder.

item.title: Case heads to trial after apex court ruling
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A high-profile spat between two rival Teochew groups over a historic building is set to proceed to trial after a decision by the Court of Appeal on Monday.

item.title: 2 accused of leaving places of accommodation illegally
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A man allegedly met his friends repeatedly at his hotel's basement carpark while serving his stay-home notice (SHN) and even took one of them up to his room.

item.title: Fake stay-home notice checkers recruited to harass debtors
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Loan sharks have been posting fake job advertisements on online marketplaces and social media to recruit people to harass debtors under the guise of enforcing coronavirus stay-home notices, the police warned yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: New cloth masks for all residents as Singapore ramps up production
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

All residents are set to receive locally produced, reusable cloth masks in a third mask distribution exercise.

item.title: Two charged in separate harassment cases
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Even with Singapore hunkering down to curb the spread of the coronavirus and the circuit breaker measures in place, a group of friends met in Orchard Road to drink and make merry.

item.title: Generation Grit: Childhood cancer left him blind but he never lost sight of his dream
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

John Danesh Krishnan was just four months old when he was diagnosed with stage four retinoblastoma - a form of eye cancer that commonly affects young children.

item.title: Online ceremonies to mark Vesak Day
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Mr Bryan Long, manager of Thekchen Choling temple near Lavender Street, preparing for a livestream of a ceremony on the eve of Vesak Day.

item.title: Dengue fight goes to Choa Chu Kang, Bukit Batok
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Project Wolbachia, Singapore's stealth weapon against dengue fever, will be expanded to Choa Chu Kang and Bukit Batok this month to suppress the Aedes aegypti mosquito population as the country battles a surge in dengue cases as well as the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: No severe inflammatory symptoms in infected children in Singapore: MOH
item.description:
May 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Covid-19 has infected 57 children - those aged 16 and younger - in Singapore so far.
